intro: Delissea mceldowneyi, commonly known as the McEldowney's delissea, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within humid forests. It is notable for its unique floral structure, which includes a prominent, spurred calyx. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
